intro: Pentas verruculosa, commonly known as the velvet pentas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit. It is adaptable to various soil types but prefers well-drained soil and moderate watering. Pentas verruculosa is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
